instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.SSD_PWR_EN: What is SSD_PWR_EN? SSD_PWR_EN is a signal that tells the chip making the power rail for the SSD to turn on when it is high. Signals with _EN on the end enable whatever came before the _EN if the signal is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage does not see SSD,
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage (near SMC) does not see SSD, SSD is checked in differnt mac and works perfect.+


<SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL>  3.278v
<SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> 0.451v
<SIGNAL>P3V3SSD_VMON</SIGNAL> 0.029v should be 0.7v
<RESISTOR>R3740</RESISTOR>
<RESISTOR>R3741</RESISTOR>
<RESISTOR>R3742</RESISTOR>

after replacing r37/40/41/42 i got <SIGNAL>P3V3SSD_VMON</SIGNAL> 0.998v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage does not see SSD,
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL> at start (boot) it is 3.248 volt, then goes down to 0,451v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage does not see SSD,
threads.message: If there was corrosion on <RESISTOR>R3740</RESISTOR>/41/42 it make sense that there is something up with <CHIP>U3740</CHIP> pulling down <SIGNAL>SSD_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage does not see SSD,
threads.message:
oke, there was no corrosion on those resistors, just replaced them to make sure.

there is no resistor on <RESISTOR>R1620</RESISTOR> it also did not look like there was ever one there....???

i made a wire on <RESISTOR>R1620</RESISTOR> pads and it works 100% perfect atm, after the boot i turned it off again and wil place a resistor on the <RESISTOR>R1620</RESISTOR> pads

but if i do that wil i take a risk of killing the machine ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage does not see SSD,
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R1620</RESISTOR> is a pull up resistor wich make SSD enable on S0 state, <RESISTOR>R1696</RESISTOR> is a pull up resistor wich makes SSD enable on S3 state, so, <RESISTOR>R1696</RESISTOR> makes SSD enable faster than <RESISTOR>R1620</RESISTOR>...

First check if <RESISTOR>R1696</RESISTOR> and traces are ok, also you should use a 100K resistor not a wire....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> liquid damage does not see SSD,
threads.message:
Yes like i stated wire was test iT booted now replaced with <RESISTOR>R1620</RESISTOR> 100k from donor 
<RESISTOR>R1696</RESISTOR> is good trac√©s also 
thabks for the info about faster defect
